# Site Operations Pickle Lake Automated Radiosonde Observing System
## Solicitation Information
### Solicitation Number
5000075621

### Title
Site Operations Pickle Lake Automated Radiosonde Observing System

### Request for Proposal (RFP) Description
Environment and Climate Change Canada is seeking a contractor to provide service and maintenance to the Vaisala Automated Radiosonde Observing System located in Pickle Lake, Ontario.

#### Period of Performance
The contract will commence on April 1, 2024, and end on March 31, 2026, with the option to extend for an additional three periods of one year each.

#### Evaluation Criteria
The selection will be based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price, with a ratio of 70% for technical merit and 30% for price.

#### Security Requirements
A security questionnaire must be completed by the bidder prior to contract award.

#### Trade Agreements
This procurement is subject to the provisions of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), the World Trade Organization – Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), and the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP).

#### Social Procurement
Environment and Climate Change Canada is committed to increasing the participation of businesses from under-represented groups in government procurement opportunities. Businesses owned or led by Canadians from under-represented groups, including women, LGBTQ2+ persons, persons with disabilities, and persons from visible minorities, are encouraged to submit a bid.

#### Evaluation and Award Process
The evaluation process will be based on the following criteria: technical merit, price, and past performance.

#### Bidding Requirements
Bidders must obtain a copy of the solicitation document and evaluation criteria prior to submitting their bid.

## Procurement Information
### Evaluation Method
Competition – Open bidding

### Evaluation Criteria
Technical merit (70%), price (30%)

### Evaluation Weighting
Technical merit: 70%
Price: 30%

### Evaluation Process
The evaluation process will be based on the evaluation criteria and weightings set out above.

## Tender Contact Information
### Contact Person
Caitlin Andersen
867 Lakeshore Road, Burlington, ON L7
